meanings.definition: A horizontal, usually underground stem that often sends out roots and shoots from its nodes.
meanings.sent1: The rhizomata of the plant spread beneath the soil.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners use rhizomata to propagate certain types of plants.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit thought the rhizomata were a secret underground maze.
meanings.sent4: The rhizomata of ideas interconnected and grew into a network of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The rhizomata, like hidden highways, connected the entire garden together.

meanings.definition: A creeping rootstock or underground stem.
meanings.sent1: The rhizomata slowly extended across the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: The rhizomata of the ivy plant spread quickly and covered the wall.
meanings.sent3: The rhizomata seemed to be playing hide and seek with the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The rhizomata of rumors snaked through the town, spreading gossip.
meanings.sent5: The rhizomata intertwined like a secret web beneath the surface of the earth.
